description.text: If you are interested in the making of Urbanising The Digital Landscape you can dive into the Notes & Sources index here

data.name: Area G
data.label: Design, Creative Direction
data.description: Founded by Alexandre Gama, Marcio Ribas, and Silvia Tommasini, Area.G is a new independent creative communication firm part of Inovnation Hub. This is the second project in partnership with Kaleidoz lead by Helio Rosas, and the photographer Gustavo Lacerda. Together we devised this cinematographic atmosphere for Area.G's visual identity.

primary.highlight: Together we devised this cinematographic atmosphere for Area.G's visual identity.

title.text: DESIGNER, CREATIVE DIRECTOR, AND JURY AT THE AWWWARDS

description.text: Over the past 10 years Bruno has worked across the Atlantic for clients and agencies in the United Kingdom, The Netherlands, Germany, Italy, United States, Canada, and Brazil — arching from financial, retail, food & drink, outsourcing, and non-profit organisations. These companies includes Facebook, Toyota, Samsung, Pepsi, Gatorade and agencies such as Jam3, Sapient Razorfish, Nurun, among many others.

Currently writing a book called Urbanising The Digital Landscape
to investigate the influence of the Architectural International Style on the current web landscape.

data.name: Erika Moreira
data.label: Visual Design
data.description: The portfolio of Erika Moreira, the award-winning copywriter that happens to be my lovely wife, is a particularly interesting project that I’m very proud to have worked on. A rather simple layout and structure to present her top-notch work started as a colour experiment after spending months studying colour relationships based on the works of Josef Albers that emphasises the tone of each case of her incredible career.

primary.highlight: A rather simple layout and structure to present her top-notch work

data.name: Claudia M. Salles
data.label: Visual Design
data.description: Working under the supervision of Creative Director Sandro Bianco, together we built a new digital experience for Claudia Moreira Salles, undeniable amongst Brazilian most important designers of the decade,  to transform her then just released book into a digital portfolio. As a designer herself we worked very close to devise a joyful experience that do not speak louder than the work itself but rather a frame to her astonishing modernist furniture and exhibitions.

primary.highlight: Abroad Claudia is represented by Espasso with galleries in Miami, New York,Los Angeles,  and London.

data.name: Inovnation
data.label: Design, Creative Direction
data.description: Designing the digital presence for Inovnation was the first of a series of projects held with Kaleidoz, a design thinking company led by Helio Rosas part of a new innovation group led by Alexandre Gama the former Chairman of BBDO-London and founder of Neogama. For this project we partnered with graphic designer Pedro Veneziano to design a series of digital flags for the brand identity, and with Luiz Rodrigues who led the tech implementation.

primary.highlight: Designing the digital presence for Inovnation was the first of a series of projects held with Kaleidoz

data.name: Gatorade
data.label: Design, Creative Direction
data.description:
In 2016, a partnership between Studio—BA, 55/Brands, Talk, Box1824 was created to drive a massive consumer behaviour research for PepsiCo that would culminate in an entirely new energy drink. Our team was spread over 6 cities across 5 countries in Latin America: Colombia, Argentina, Brazil, Mexico, and Chile. 

The entire research took six months to be completed and along with a book to consolidate the data we designed an iOS app: a platform for learning, fostering insights and communication across Gatorade marketing teams in different offices around the globe.

primary.highlight: A platform for learning, foster insights and communication across Gatorade global marketing teams.

data.title: Bruno Arizio — Interactive Designer
data.description: Bruno Arizio is a designer and writer based in Milan, Italy. Over the past 9 years he has worked as a freelance designer for companies across the Atlantic in the US, Latin America and Europe.
